fields.name: author
fields.description: A list of authors

fields.name: viewer
fields.description: The currently authenticated user

types.name: Slug
types.description: A lower kebab case string

types.name: Author
types.description: An author of a piece of writing

fields.name: image
fields.description: URL for the image of an author

fields.name: name
fields.description: The name of the author

fields.name: hasLeadAssets
fields.description: Some authors have poor article lead assets, this flag denotes that the lead assets are useful for presentation purposes

fields.name: twitter
fields.description: Twitter handle for an author (can be an empty string)

types.name: ID
types.description: The `ID` scalar type represents a unique identifier, often used to refetch an object or as key for a cache. The ID type appears in a JSON response as a String; however, it is not intended to be human-readable. When expected as an input type, any string (such as `"4"`) or integer (such as `4`) input value will be accepted as an ID.

fields.name: count
fields.description: The number of articles written by an author

fields.name: list
fields.description: List of articles written by an author

args.name: first
args.description: The maximum number of articles you want to take, defaults to 10

args.name: skip
args.description: The number of articles to skip over, useful for paging, defaults to 0

types.name: Int
types.description: The `Int` scalar type represents non-fractional signed whole numeric values. Int can represent values between -(2^31) and 2^31 - 1.

fields.name: byline
fields.description: An AST of one or more authors that may contain job titles and/or locations

args.name: maxWordCount
args.description: If a teaser is required, use to truncate the article content by words. If the client doesn't have permission for the content, the maximum will be the lesser of the predefined teaser length and requested maximum

args.name: maxCharCount
args.description: If summary text is required, use to truncate the article content by characters. If the client doesn't have permission for the content, the maximum will be the lesser of the predefined teaser length and requested maximum. Has no effect if maxWordCount is specified

fields.name: flags
fields.description: A list of time dependent with pair dependencies

fields.name: label
fields.description: A free piece of text to describe an article

fields.name: commentsEnabled
fields.description: A flag set outside of the commenting system, usually used for controversial articles

fields.name: commercialTags
fields.description: A rarely populated field that is a list of free text such as ["luxury", "ferarri"]

fields.name: keywords
fields.description: A field that is populated from the article headline, a string delineated with commas such as ["this,is,a,headline"]

fields.name: section
fields.description: The name of the segment that the article appears in, for example Sport in a newspaper

fields.name: relatedArticles
fields.description: Curated list of articles selected by editorial that appear at the end of an article

fields.name: relatedArticlesLayout
fields.description: Presentational information on how the related articles should be displayed

fields.name: relatedArticleSlice
fields.description: Related article slice

fields.name: standfirst
fields.description: A brief introductory summary, typically appearing immediately after the headline and typographically distinct from the rest of the article

fields.name: summary
fields.description: A predefined truncated version of the article with a max length of the teaser, can optionally choose a shorter length. Use this to avoid ACS.

fields.name: title
fields.deprecationReason: Use headline instead which is more descriptive in the context of an article

fields.name: topics
fields.description: Topics that the requested article belong to

types.name: Markup
types.description: An AST representing cross platform UI

types.name: String
types.description: The `String` scalar type represents textual data, represented as UTF-8 character sequences. The String type is most often used by GraphQL to represent free-form human-readable text.

types.name: UUID
types.description: Represents a UUID

types.name: Boolean
types.description: The `Boolean` scalar type represents `true` or `false`.

types.name: Ratio
types.description: Two floats colon delimited as a string

types.name: Crop
types.description: The selected area for a given image and its ratio

types.name: URL
types.description: Represents a URL

types.name: DateTime
types.description: Represents a date and time of day in ISO 8601

types.name: Layout
types.description: A selection of template types that have opinions over how they should be presented. Usually used within the context of an associated list of articles

types.name: Template
types.description: Predefined template names that should be used by all systems interested in templates to denote the template layout

types.name: Tile
types.description: An article presentation

fields.name: description
fields.description: A short sentence to describe the topic

fields.name: count
fields.description: The number of articles in a given topic

fields.name: list
fields.description: List of articles associated with that topic

args.name: first
args.description: The maximum number of articles you want to take, defaults to 10

args.name: skip
args.description: The number of articles to skip over, useful for paging, defaults to 0

fields.name: count
fields.description: The number of articles that satisfy the filter

args.name: first
args.description: The maximum number of articles you want to take, defaults to 10

args.name: skip
args.description: The number of articles to skip over, useful for paging, defaults to 0

types.name: Edition
types.description: An edition for a single day

fields.name: updateText
fields.description: Journalist inputted text which denotes the last time an edition was published

fields.name: date
fields.description: The date that the edition is intended for, not necessarily the date it was published (contrast with `publishedTime`)

fields.name: publishedTime
fields.description: The date & time that the edition was published (contrast with `date`)

types.name: ShortDate
types.description: String formatted in ISO8601 as YYYY-MM-DD (e.g. 2018-04-18)

types.name: Sport
types.description: A sport in the sports video hub

fields.name: competitions
fields.description: A list of competitions associated to a sport

types.name: SportCompetition
types.description: A sport competition in the sports video hub

fields.name: imageUrl
fields.description: Poster image of the most recent video of a competition

fields.name: logoUrl
fields.description: Non-vector logo for competition

fields.name: groups
fields.description: A list of video groupings associated to a sport competition

types.name: SportVideoGroup
types.description: A group of sport videos (e.g. round, match day, extras, ...)

fields.name: brightcoveVideos
fields.description: A list of sport videos ordered by time of creation

types.name: BrightcoveSportVideo
types.description: A video in the sports video hub. Note that some of these videos are only licensed on mobile applications.

fields.name: spotimCodeB
fields.description: a code used for Spot.IM's Single Sign On auth. Details here: https://github.com/SpotIM/spotim-integration-docs/blob/master/api/single-sign-on/README.md

inputFields.name: metadata
inputFields.description: information about the bookmark as  key value pairs (e.g. sectionname=News)

types.name: __Schema
types.description: A GraphQL Schema defines the capabilities of a GraphQL server. It exposes all available types and directives on the server, as well as the entry points for query, mutation, and subscription operations.

fields.name: types
fields.description: A list of all types supported by this server.

fields.name: queryType
fields.description: The type that query operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: mutationType
fields.description: If this server supports mutation, the type that mutation operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: subscriptionType
fields.description: If this server support subscription, the type that subscription operations will be rooted at.

fields.name: directives
fields.description: A list of all directives supported by this server.

types.name: __Type
types.description:
The fundamental unit of any GraphQL Schema is the type. There are many kinds of types in GraphQL as represented by the `__TypeKind` enum.

Depending on the kind of a type, certain fields describe information about that type. Scalar types provide no information beyond a name and description, while Enum types provide their values. Object and Interface types provide the fields they describe. Abstract types, Union and Interface, provide the Object types possible at runtime. List and NonNull types compose other types.

types.name: __TypeKind
types.description: An enum describing what kind of type a given `__Type` is.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a scalar.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an object. `fields` and `interfaces` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an interface. `fields` and `possibleTypes` are valid fields.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a union. `possibleTypes` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an enum. `enumValues` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is an input object. `inputFields` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: LIST
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a list. `ofType` is a valid field.

enumValues.name: NON_NULL
enumValues.description: Indicates this type is a non-null. `ofType` is a valid field.

types.name: __Field
types.description: Object and Interface types are described by a list of Fields, each of which has a name, potentially a list of arguments, and a return type.

types.name: __InputValue
types.description: Arguments provided to Fields or Directives and the input fields of an InputObject are represented as Input Values which describe their type and optionally a default value.

fields.name: defaultValue
fields.description: A GraphQL-formatted string representing the default value for this input value.

types.name: __EnumValue
types.description: One possible value for a given Enum. Enum values are unique values, not a placeholder for a string or numeric value. However an Enum value is returned in a JSON response as a string.

types.name: __Directive
types.description:
A Directive provides a way to describe alternate runtime execution and type validation behavior in a GraphQL document.

In some cases, you need to provide options to alter GraphQL's execution behavior in ways field arguments will not suffice, such as conditionally including or skipping a field. Directives provide this by describing additional information to the executor.

types.name: __DirectiveLocation
types.description: A Directive can be adjacent to many parts of the GraphQL language, a __DirectiveLocation describes one such possible adjacencies.

enumValues.name: QUERY
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a query operation.

enumValues.name: MUTATION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a mutation operation.

enumValues.name: SUBSCRIPTION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a subscription operation.

enumValues.name: FIELD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment definition.

enumValues.name: FRAGMENT_SPREAD
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a fragment spread.

enumValues.name: INLINE_FRAGMENT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an inline fragment.

enumValues.name: SCHEMA
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a schema definition.

enumValues.name: SCALAR
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a scalar definition.

enumValues.name: OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an object type definition.

enumValues.name: FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a field definition.

enumValues.name: ARGUMENT_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an argument definition.

enumValues.name: INTERFACE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an interface definition.

enumValues.name: UNION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to a union definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum definition.

enumValues.name: ENUM_VALUE
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an enum value definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_OBJECT
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object type definition.

enumValues.name: INPUT_FIELD_DEFINITION
enumValues.description: Location adjacent to an input object field definition.

types.name: Dictionary
types.description: An dictionary of string-based key-value pairs

types.name: RichText
types.description: An AST representing cross platform UI

types.name: DailyUniversalRegisterItem
types.description: A piece of the daily universal register

types.name: DailyUniversalRegister
types.description: The daily universal register slice

types.name: LeadAndTwo
types.description: Three articles with one that has more importance over the others denoted by the main ID. Would usually be associated with a list of articles

types.name: OpinionAndTwo
types.description: Three articles with one that has more importance over the others denoted by the main ID. Would usually be associated with a list of articles

types.name: Default
types.description: Any number of articles with no opinion on the layout/importance of any

types.name: StandardSlice
types.description: Fallback slice without any prescribed presentation, replaces standard related-links slice (related-links)

types.name: PuffSlice
types.description: A banner containing one or many articles/links

types.name: Puff
types.description: An article/link which is displayed in a puff

types.name: FocusSlice
types.description: A focus article (focus)

types.name: LeadersSlice
types.description: Three leader articles (leaders)

types.name: LeadOneAndFourSlice
types.description: A lead article and four supporting articles (supplement-lead-and-4-stack)

types.name: LeadOneAndOneSlice
types.description: A lead article and a supporting article (lead-1-and-1)

types.name: LeadOneAndTwoSlice
types.description: A lead article and two supporting articles. This slice can also represent lead related articles slice of the same name (lead-1-and-2-puffs, related-links-lead-and-2)

types.name: LeadOneFullWidthSlice
types.description: One full width lead article on its own (lead-1-full-width)

types.name: LeadOneNoPicAndOneAndPortraitSlice
types.description: A lead module and supporting and portrait modules (lead-1-no-pic-and-1-and-portrait)

types.name: LeadTwoNoPicAndTwoSlice
types.description: Two leads without pictures along and a pair of supporting articles (lead-2-no-pic-and-2)

types.name: SecondaryFourSlice
types.description: Four secondary modules (secondary-4)

types.name: SecondaryOneSlice
types.description: A singular secondary module (secondary-1)

types.name: SecondaryOneAndFourSlice
types.description: A secondary module and four supporting articles (supplement-secondary-1-and-4)

types.name: SecondaryTwoAndTwoSlice
types.description: Two secondary modules and supporting articles (secondary-2-and-2)

types.name: SecondaryTwoNoPicAndTwoSlice
types.description: Two secondary modules, without an image, and supporting articles (secondary-2-no-pic-and-2)

types.name: TwoPicAndSixNoPicSlice
types.description: A slice and two leads and six supporting articles (list-2-and-6-no-pic)

types.name: InTheNewsSlice
types.description: A special type of banner containing articles which is displayed at the top the new sections

types.name: CommentLeadAndCartoonSlice
types.description: A leading comment article and a cartoon (comment-lead-and-cartoon)

types.name: LetterThundererPodcastSlice
types.description: Trio of letter, thunderer and podcast articles (comment-1-letters-thunderer)

types.name: CommentTwoAndNotebookSlice
types.description: Two comment articles and a notebook article (comment-2-and-notebook)

types.name: SecondaryOneAndColumnistSlice
types.description: A secondary module and a special supporting columnist module (secondary-1-and-columnist)

types.name: Puzzle
types.description: A representation of a single puzzle for the puzzles section

types.name: ObituariesLeadAndTwoSlice
types.description: Special obituary lead and two support articles (obituaries-lead-and-2)

types.name: MagazineSection
types.description: A magazine section, e.g. Culture, Style, ST Magazine

types.name: OpinionOneAndTwoSlice
types.description: A lead opinion related articles slice (related-links-opinion-and-2)

inputFields.name: duration
inputFields.description: The number of seconds for which this flag applies following the publishedTime. Null would apply indefinitely.

inputFields.name: image
inputFields.description: URL for the image of an author

inputFields.name: image
inputFields.description: URL for the image of an author

directives.name: skip
directives.description: Directs the executor to skip this field or fragment when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: include
directives.description: Directs the executor to include this field or fragment only when the `if` argument is true.

directives.name: deprecated
directives.description: Marks an element of a GraphQL schema as no longer supported.

args.name: reason
args.description: Explains why this element was deprecated, usually also including a suggestion for how to access supported similar data. Formatted in [Markdown](https://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/).
